title: Anorectal Malformation
diagnosis_topic: Imperforate anus with fistula requiring staged repair
setup_script: A newborn boy has no visible anal opening. He has not passed stool but voids normally. There is a distended abdomen and meconium appears at the urethral meatus.

dynamic_flow.reply: HR 150 bpm, RR 40/min, Temp 37.2 C; stable.
Absence of anal opening; meconium noted at urethral meatus suggesting rectourethral fistula.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders cross-table prone lateral X-ray at 24 hours
dynamic_flow.reply: Determines distance between rectal pouch and perineal skin (high vs. low lesion).

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates for associated anomalies
dynamic_flow.reply: Renal ultrasound, echocardiogram and spinal ultrasound to look for VACTERL association.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident keeps patient NPO and places replogle tube for gastric decompression

dynamic_flow.reply: High malformation: diverting colostomy with mucous fistula followed by posterior sagittal anorectoplasty (PSARP) at 3-6 months; low malformation: primary perineal anoplasty soon after birth.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident counsels parents on colostomy care
dynamic_flow.reply: Demonstrate stoma care and signs of complications.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays creation of colostomy in high lesion
dynamic_flow.reply: Risk of perforation and sepsis increases.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident addresses urinary tract evaluation
dynamic_flow.reply: Voiding cystourethrogram to define fistula and ensure renal function.
Constipation, soiling and strictures; requires bowel management program and dilatations.
Involve urology, nephrology, gastroenterology and physical therapy.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident provides long-term follow-up plan
dynamic_flow.reply: Continence assessments throughout childhood and support for psychosocial issues.

critical_decision_points: Identification of anorectal malformation and associated fistula
Staged surgical management based on lesion level
Parental education on colostomy care and postoperative expectations
Long-term bowel management and multidisciplinary follow-up
